definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
tube/cylinder/to encase in sth cylindrical (such as hands in sleeves etc)

sentences.english: May the colorful kaleidoscopes arouse memories of your childhood?
sentences.chinese: 五彩斑斓的万花筒是否能唤起你童年的回忆呢？

sentences.english: Because the kaleidoscope had settled into what appeared to be a pleasing pattern.
sentences.chinese: 原因是万花筒出现了看似悦目的图案。

sentences.english: Distinctive originality which is always reflected in the polytropic shopping space brings fashionistas life kaleidoscope.
sentences.chinese: 独特创意的百变空间，开启时尚达人生活万花筒。

sentences.english: Thoughts appear as kaleidoscopic patterns of light and sound.
sentences.chinese: 思想显现为光和声的万花筒般的图案。

sentences.english: It will be an adventure of musical kaleidoscopes not to be missed.
sentences.chinese: 这将是一个冒险的音乐万花筒不容错过。

sentences.english: Perhaps I am lost in love , I have kaleidoscopic wings .
sentences.chinese: 也许我失去了爱情，还有我万花筒般的翅膀。
生活犹如万花筒，五彩缤纷。

sentences.english: Kaleidoscopes of loud heartbeats under coats.
sentences.chinese: 外套下隐藏的是万花筒般的心跳。

sentences.english: For ethnics who want to add their culture to the mosaic that is America.
sentences.chinese: 为想把自己的文化添入美国万花筒的少数族裔说话。

definition: all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
bright and multicolored/of rich variety/(fig.) dazzling/glitzy
like a heavenly steed, soaring across the skies (idiom)/(of writing, calligraphy etc) bold and imaginative/unconstrained in style
see 五彩繽紛|五彩缤纷[wu3 cai3 bin1 fen1]
